alert.note: Alert for Logan; McDowell; Mingo; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 12:32PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Dickenson, Buchanan, western McDowell, southeastern Mingo, west central Raleigh, southeastern Logan, western Wyoming and southern Boone Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1231 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near R.d. Bailey Lake to 7 miles north of Walnut Hill. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grundy, Pineville, Davenport, Oceana, Hanover, R.d. Bailey Lake, Gilbert Creek, Mallory, Amherstdale-Robinette, Gilbert, Davy, Bradshaw, Iaeger, Coal Mountain, Jolo, Oakwood, Bruno, Hurley, Avondale and Wolf Pen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
